dishes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the spaghetti until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving some pasta water.
In a skillet, cook the pancetta or guanciale until crispy. Remove from heat and set aside.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, grated Pecorino Romano cheese, and a generous amount of freshly ground black pepper.
Add the cooked pancetta/guanciale to the egg mixture and stir.
Toss the cooked spaghetti in the egg mixture until well coated. If needed, add a bit of reserved pasta water to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately with extra Pecorino Romano and black pepper on top.

dishes.name: Chicken Stir-Fry
ingredients: 500g boneless, skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced
2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, snow peas, etc.), sliced
steps: In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, and cornstarch to create the sauce. Set aside. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat. Add minced garlic and grated ginger, sauté for a minute until fragrant. Add sliced chicken to the skillet and cook until it's no longer pink. Add the mixed vegetables and stir-fry for a few minutes until they are tender-crisp. Pour the sauce over the chicken and vegetables, and toss everything together until well coated and heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve the chicken stir-fry over steamed rice.

dishes.name: Caprese Salad
steps: Arrange the tomato slices and mozzarella slices on a serving platter, alternating them. Tuck fresh basil leaves between the tomato and mozzarella slices. Drizzle extra-virgin olive oil over the salad. Optionally, add a few swirls of balsamic glaze for extra flavor. Sprinkle with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Serve immediately as a refreshing appetizer or side dish.

dishes.name: Vegetable Biryani
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, potatoes, peas, beans, etc.), diced
Saffron strands soaked in milk (for garnish, optional)
Fresh coriander leaves and fried onions for garnish (optional)
steps: Wash the basmati rice until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes, then drain. Heat ghee or vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the whole spices (cinnamon stick, cloves, cardamom pods, bay leaf, cumin seeds) and sauté until fragrant. Add the sliced onions and cook until they turn golden brown. Stir in the ginger-garlic paste and sauté for another minute. Add the diced vegetables, biryani masala, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. Cook for a few minutes until the vegetables start to soften. In a separate bowl, mix the plain yogurt and milk. Add this mixture to the pot and season with salt. Layer the soaked and drained basmati rice over the vegetable mixture in the pot. Sprinkle saffron-soaked milk over the rice for a lovely aroma and color (optional). Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid and cook on low heat for about 20-25 minutes or until the rice is fully cooked and fluffy. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and fried onions (optional) before serving.
